alert.note: Alert for Johnson; Northwest Carter; Southeast Carter; Sullivan; Unicoi; Washington (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 14 at 1:24AM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Sullivan, east central Washington, northeastern Unicoi, southwestern Johnson and Carter Counties through 300 AM EDT... At 224 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Elizabethton, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Johnson City, Elizabethton, Central, Hampton, Pine Crest, Midway, Unicoi, Watauga, Hunter and Roane Mountain State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Johnson; Northwest Carter; Southeast Carter; Sullivan; Unicoi; Washington
